author: Colneth Smiley Jr.
title: DA names Beverly cop in Hamilton man's fatal shooting | Herald Bulldog | First On The Street
text:
Essex District Attorney John Blodgett's office has identified the police officer involved in the fatal shooting of a Hamilton man who was allegedly on a suicidal rampage when he rammed his SUV into police cruisers and another civilian vehicle Saturday.
Beverly Police Patrol Officer April Clarizia, “fired a single shot through the driver's side window” which struck Christopher Whitmarsh, 49, after he was ordered to stop ramming his GMC Envoy into a Toyota Highlander and two police cruisers, according to the DA's office.
Whitmarsh was struck in the left shoulder but was pronounced dead after he was transported to Beverly Hospital.
The incident is still under investigation to determine if Clarizia, a 12-year-veteran, was justified in shooting Whitmarsh.
“When a police officer uses lethal force, the public should necessarily expect a thorough and transparent investigation,” Blodgett said in today's statement. “When our investigation is finished, a complete report will be released to the public, after we have shared it with Mr. Whitmarsh’s family.”
Around 3:10 p.m., Saturday, Clarizia and another officer responded to a report of a suicidal man on Balch Street behind the Cummings Center business complex.
Neighbors described Whitmarsh to the Herald as a seemingly “normal guy.” Police indicated that Whitmarsh knew one of the passengers inside the vehicle he initially rammed.
